transcripts.text: According to our common sense, we think that ideology is something blurring, confusing our straight view.  Ideology should be glasses which distort our view.  End.  The critique of ideology should be the opposite, like you take off the glasses so that you can finally see the way things really are.  This precisely is the ultimate illusion.  Ideology is not simply imposed on ourselves.  Ideologies are spontaneous illusions.  relationship to our social world, how we perceive its meaning, and so on and so on.  We, in a way, enjoy our ideology.  This truth can be painful, can shatter many of your illusions.  You must be forced to be free.  If you trust simply your spontaneous sense of well-being, you will never get free.  Freedom hurts.
